This page likely provides detailed documentation on the Nomic Atlas API, enabling developers to programmatically interact with Atlas for tasks such as dataset uploads, embedding management, and visualization generation.

sections.title: Introduction to the Atlas API
sections.details: An overview of the API, its functionality, and how it facilitates programmatic interaction with Nomic Atlas.

sections.title: Authentication and API Key Management
sections.details: Step-by-step instructions for obtaining an API key, setting up authentication headers, and securing API usage.

details.description: Used to upload, update, and manage datasets.
Facilitates the creation, querying, and management of data maps.

sections.title: Uploading Datasets and Embeddings
sections.details: Detailed instructions and examples for uploading datasets and embeddings via the API, including supported file formats and payload structures.

sections.title: Generating Data Maps
sections.details: How to create and customize data maps programmatically, including setting parameters for visualization and clustering.

sections.title: Querying Data Maps and Metadata
sections.details: Instructions for retrieving insights from data maps, querying metadata, and performing analyses via API calls.

sections.title: Error Handling and Debugging
sections.details: Common API errors, their causes, and troubleshooting tips for resolving issues.

sections.title: Rate Limits and Performance Optimization
sections.details: Information about API rate limits, best practices for efficient usage, and tips for optimizing performance when working with large datasets.

sections.title: API Use Cases
details: Batch embedding uploads for large-scale projects
Programmatic creation of interactive data maps for analytics dashboards
